data.title: Yum appetizers!
data.text: Loved the Arvada Hash! Pork sandwich was very good also. Food was served on metal trays, very fun presentation. We'll be back!

data.title: Good Arvada BBQ
data.text: Love the selection of food and drinks, fun place and great atmosphere. Great for after work get togethers and kicking back.

data.title: You have to have the smokehouse!
data.text: This is the first time I've been here and it did not disappoint. I had the smokehouse burger which was pulled pork on a burger. ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE.

data.title: Food is average.  Atmosphere is good!
data.text: I found the reviews on line and decided to try it coming out of the mountains.  The building is great with an awesome patio.  I ordered the chicken and brisket.  The chicken is what they claim on there menu is a specialty.   It was SO DRY, like difficult to eat dry!  I could not eat it.   A napkin has more moisture in it.  The brisket was average.  The slaw was good.  The beans must be from a can.  Place is clean and staff was friendly.

data.title: BEST Apps ever!
data.text:
I stopped her for a dinner and decided to just order some appetizers (Wings and Arvada Hash). Not only were the portions amazingly large enough to feed myself and my fiance. 

They bring out all their BBQ sauces for you to select from, all unique in flavor and spice level. Their beer specials are decently priced and the atmosphere is welcoming.

data.title: Great ribs!
data.text: I'm not normally a ribs kinda gal but theirs were amazing! Blackened, fall off the bone, tasty enough to make me realize why people like ribs! Great to have another delicious option in old town!

data.title: Go early for dinner - later for drinks
data.text: The boneless wings are good.  My husband enjoyed the smoke house burger.  They have several unique flavors of whiskey (I'm not a whiskey drinker, but the pecan is delicious!)  As the evening progressed, the bar area got louder & louder.  There were some regular tables around the inside perimeter & some smaller (kid-like) tables in the center of the front room.  The service was good.

data.title: Solid choice for beer and some BBQ
data.text: Restaurant has a nice outdoor area as well, and the food was very good. Service was OK but not great, but it had a great bar area, plenty of TV's if you want to watch a game or event there as well - and the BBQ was very good.

data.title: Smokin' good food!
data.text: If you like BBQ and smoked meats, you will like 4 Barrels! The atmosphere is relaxed and casual. They have a full bar and carry some local craft beers on tap.  I really like their smoked wings.  With or without sauce, they are solo tasty!

data.title: Great Food & Service
data.text: We've been here a few times and the place is great!  The food very good.  I have tried the smokehouse burger, which is delectable - a hamburger, cooked to perfection and topped with pulled pork.  My husband has tried virtually all of their BBQ items and raves about it every time.  Their Tater Tots are perfectly cooked.  The atmosphere here is great and the staff is wonderful!  Recommend it!!!

data.title: 4 Barrel a Barrel of Food Fun
data.text:
Old Town Arvada is a delightful place to taste great food and drink and the 4 Barrel didn't disappoint. We went just a few days after visiting another BBQ place, but decided, what the heck, you can never have enough good "Q."

Could not have been more pleased. There were 4 of us in the party and what we liked was a nice selection of food, and not an overweening selection of beverages.

I had a burger, but it was topped with pulled pork and bacon served on Texas Toast. OK, not health food. But along with a side of potato salad and a couple of cold drafts, it was terrific. Especially liked there serving sizes are not huge, but just right.

Others in our group had a couple of delightful salads and other BBQ treats. Atmosphere is, while not a large place, very open with plenty of elbow room. In this world of chain restaurants, it's nice to see an original and unique dining experience. Service was first-rate.

We will be back!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Fantastic service! I'd highly recommend the smoked chicken or the brisket. Ribs were tasty, but not pull from the bone. The sauces were great, but the meat stands alone--it doesn't need it!

data.title: BBQ in Old Town Arvada
data.text: We went there on a Friday evening to give the place a try.  We arrived around 6:30 PM and the place was not that busy.  Our servers where in the middle of a shift change which impacted overall service but it remained average.  They tried hard but couldn't overcome the "gap" of changing after ordering, then delivering.  The bartender made good effort to ensure contact.  The place started filling up around 7:30.  The food was average BBQ but maybe the cooks were shift changing also.  I had smoked wings which were better than other venues in Arvada but the buffalo chicken salad was not overwhelming for my wife.  We might give this another try either for lunch or a later dinner.

data.title: Worst BBQ Ever
data.text: Absolute worst BBQ I've ever had.  Ribs, how about three small ribs as a meal, over cooked dried out.  Gross fries and greasy fries

data.title: WOW. WOW. And did I mention WOW?
data.text: Holy Crap this place is GOOD. Mouth watering is right. I couldn't stop eating my bbq! I got the smoked chicken and baked beans. It. Was. Delicious. Fell right off the bone. I have a new favorite banquet restaurant. Go there right away!

data.title: Very cool atmosphere and great BBQ!
data.text: I went to a business lunch here,  and was pleasantly surprised!  This new restaurant in Arvada's Old Towne is a great addition.  The decor revitalized the original design of the building,  a mid-century service station.    The bulk of the seating space is on the covered patio.  We tried the Arvada Hash: fried, smashed-up tater tots topped with pork, green chili and cheese!  It was awesome!  I had a beef brisket sandwich--good stuff! Be sure to try their white bbq sauce too!

data.title: Great Sauces!
data.text: This is solid BBQ.  We started with the sausage sampler app.  Very good and plentiful.  We were there for lunch and the ribs still had three hours to go in the smoker.  That was a disappointment :(  I had the pulled pork sandwich with slaw on top. Side of beans.  Beans were delish with pieces of meat floating around.  The bun on the sandwich was superb!  The pork was good, too.  The slaw on the sandwich was quite bland and dry.  Not at detractor but added nothing to the sandwich.  Reports were that the proteins all around were good.  Beans also. Potato salad, not so much.  I would definitely return.  The sauces on the table were outstanding!  The White and Bourbon were my favorites.  Good service, too.

data.title: Beer, BBQ and Great Food
data.text: This restaurant has a lot of covered outdoor seating. We shared two appetizers, which were plentty of food for two and a good substitute for an entree. We shared a sausage sampler that included Italian sausage, German bratwurst and Polish sausage and they were all tasty. I don't usually like Polish sausage but enjoyed it very much. The sampler included roasted jalapenos and Texas toast. The only complaint is that the roasted jalapenos were served cold and would have been better served warm, We also shared the jalapeno hushpuppies that were crispy on the outside and soft and yummy on the inside. They had a good amount of heat and were not overpowering. We tasted all 5 BBQ sauces and can't wait to return for pulled pork and brisket. We drank Epic Brewing Company Brainless raspberry ale that was not too sweet and went well with the food.

data.title: Good service & average food on this visit
data.text:
I put "on this visit" in the title of my review because, to be very clear, I will be back in the future.  

This was my first visit to 4 Barrel.  When I walked in, my first impression was that they had done a pretty nice job with the space.  Not nearly as open as what it was when it was the previous establishment, but 4 Barrel has different cooking requirements and is shooting for a different atmosphere.  I felt a bit closed in, but all in all, they did a good job.

They have some interesting dishes on the menu which are not common such as smoked eggs and deep fried Oreos.  Both sound very interesting, but given this was the first visit, I just wanted to judge the BBQ.

I had pulled pork and the Jalapeno Brat along with beans and a side salad.  Let me take each individually:

* Pulled pork: Good taste, cooked perfectly, but was a bit fatty.  I had 4 chunks of fat in my serving.  Not huge, but shouldn't have been there.  The person I went with also had some fat in her pulled pork sandwich.  Strange, but nonetheless, the pork had a good flavor.

* Jalapeno brat: Quite good.  Cooked perfectly.  I'd have liked it to have a lot more heat, but it was tasty as a mild jalapeno brat.

* Beans: This is where things weren't quite as expected.  The beans tasted good, but didn't look good.  They were served in a metal tin, which was interesting, but the tin was so large that it looked like a miniscule amount of beans, even though it was a very reasonable portion.  In addition, they were just a flat brown.  There was no variation in color to them.  Think about refried beans, not in consistency, but in color.  That was these.  They need to add in some small chunks of bacon or pork or peppers/onions or something to give the consistency and color some variation.  Just an opinion.  Like I said, they tasted decent.

* Side salad: Flat out bad.  The lettuce was so wilted it was terrible.  It should never have been served.  Perhaps the owner may reply to this review and ask why I didn't bring it up to our server.  First, it should have been obvious to the kitchen.  No excuse.  Second, well, I'll to that in "service" below.

Overall, salad aside, the food was good and reasonably priced.  Good enough that I'll give it another try.  I think a few small refinements (get the fat out of the pork, add some color/consistency to the baked beans, and don't serve wilted lettuce) will go a long way.

Service:  Our waitress was prompt in getting to us and had recommendations available.  (I like a server with an opinion.  When they say, "It's all good", it usually isn't.)  She was friendly and the orders came out promptly and correct.  She also took our plates promptly when we finished and asked if we wanted anything else.  She brought and took care of the check quickly.  The only slip up, and reason #2 why I didn't complain about the salad, was that after the food came out, she came over very quickly to ask how everything was.  I hadn't yet had a bite.  I told her that and that I would tell her in a few minutes, but she never came back and asked.  So, no question, no feedback on the salad.  

All in all, my experience was fair.  Some good, some not so good, some in the middle.  Good enough that I'll be back again and hopefully be able to give another star or two and a better review.  I like supporting our local businesses, hope they take feedback to heart, and succeed.

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text: Great selection of food and bar beverages.  Had the 1/2 BBQ chicken and it was very good.  Nice atmosphere and out door seating
